com.abdulrhmanil.wallhavenwallpapers.fragments.adapters

Class LocalPhotosAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<LocalPhotosAdapter.LocalPhotoViewHolder>
      • com.abdulrhmanil.wallhavenwallpapers.fragments.adapters.LocalPhotosAdapter

  • public class LocalPhotosAdapter
extends android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<LocalPhotosAdapter.LocalPhotoViewHolder>
    Recycler View Adapter that adapt our local photos in their full resolution into the the RecyclerView. So we can show them to the user. This adapter is for the local Photos objects ... The localPhoto is an instance that hold a basis info for the local photos.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  LocalPhotosAdapter.LocalPhotoViewHolder
      A static nested class that represent an item in the RecyclerView.

      A context

      A inflater that inflate XML to view
      private java.util.List<LocalPhoto> localPhotosList
      List that hold the local photos objects, that hold a basis info for the local downloaded photos
      private LocalPhotosDataSource localPhotosUtil
      A singleton that hold the local photo list.
      private OnPressLocalPhoto onPressLocalPhoto
      Listener that responsible for the action we apply when press on local photo, so when we press on local photo this functional interaction interface call : startScrollZoomedPhotosFragment method, that show ScrollZoomedPhotosFragment fragment.
      private static com.bumptech.glide.request.RequestOptions REQUEST_OPTIONS
      Is the default content of the image view, and the content that showed in case NO internet
      private DisplayUtil.ThumbRes thumbRes
      Util object that calculate the image view width and height, and the num of images in on row

      • onPressLocalPhoto

        private final OnPressLocalPhoto onPressLocalPhoto
        Listener that responsible for the action we apply when press on local photo, so when we press on local photo this functional interaction interface call : startScrollZoomedPhotosFragment method, that show ScrollZoomedPhotosFragment fragment. this fragment show us the local photos in fullscreen mode with the option to zoom in/out. You must provide the implementation and send it in the constructor.

      • onCreateViewHolder

        public LocalPhotosAdapter.LocalPhotoViewHolder onCreateViewHolder(android.view.ViewGroup parent,
                                                                  int viewType)
        Description copied from class: android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter
        Called when RecyclerView needs a new RecyclerView.ViewHolder of the given type to represent an item.

        This new ViewHolder should be constructed with a new View that can represent the items of the given type. You can either create a new View manually or inflate it from an XML layout file.

        The new ViewHolder will be used to display items of the adapter using #onBindViewHolder(ViewHolder, int, List). Since it will be re-used to display different items in the data set, it is a good idea to cache references to sub views of the View to avoid unnecessary View.findViewById(int) calls.

        Specified by:
        onCreateViewHolder in class android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<LocalPhotosAdapter.LocalPhotoViewHolder>
        Parameters:
        parent - The ViewGroup into which the new View will be added after it is bound to an adapter position.
        viewType - The view type of the new View.
        Returns:
        A new ViewHolder that holds a View of the given view type.
        See Also:
        RecyclerView.Adapter.getItemViewType(int), #onBindViewHolder(ViewHolder, int)

      • onBindViewHolder

        public void onBindViewHolder(LocalPhotosAdapter.LocalPhotoViewHolder holder,
                             int position)
        Description copied from class: android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter
        Called by RecyclerView to display the data at the specified position. This method should update the contents of the RecyclerView.ViewHolder.itemView to reflect the item at the given position.

        Note that unlike ListView, RecyclerView will not call this method again if the position of the item changes in the data set unless the item itself is invalidated or the new position cannot be determined. For this reason, you should only use the position parameter while acquiring the related data item inside this method and should not keep a copy of it. If you need the position of an item later on (e.g. in a click listener), use RecyclerView.ViewHolder.getAdapterPosition() which will have the updated adapter position. Override #onBindViewHolder(ViewHolder, int, List) instead if Adapter can handle efficient partial bind.

        Specified by:
        onBindViewHolder in class android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<LocalPhotosAdapter.LocalPhotoViewHolder>
        Parameters:
        holder - The ViewHolder which should be updated to represent the contents of the item at the given position in the data set.
        position - The position of the item within the adapter's data set.

      • setWallpaperIntent

        private void setWallpaperIntent(LocalPhoto localPhoto)
        Create intent to set current photo as wallpaper, and then start the set as wallpaper intent.
        Parameters:
        localPhoto - is the local photo object, hold basis info of the local photo, include the path of the local photo.

      • shareIntent

        private void shareIntent(LocalPhoto localPhoto)
        Create intent to share current wallpaper, and then start the sharing intent.
        Parameters:
        localPhoto - is the local photo object, hold basis info of the local photo, include the path of the local photo.

      • startScrollZoomedPhotosFragment

        private void startScrollZoomedPhotosFragment(int startPosition)
        Method that call startScrollZoomedPhotosFragment in onPressLocalPhoto interaction listener that his method is implemented in: Downloaded Fragment. This method start and show: ScrollZoomedPhotosFragment fragment that show the photos in full screen mode and zoom mode. so you can scroll and zoom them in full screen mode.
        Parameters:
        startPosition - is the position of the photo you want the recycler view to show as a start point (the first photo we show in zoom fullscreen mode.

      • showResDialog

        private boolean showResDialog(LocalPhoto localPhoto)
        Show the resolution (width X height) of the LocalPhoto object.
        Parameters:
        localPhoto - is the local photo object, hold basis info of the local photo, include the path of the local photo.
        Returns:
        just ignore the returned value, used for the long click listener.

      • showDeleteDialog

        private void showDeleteDialog(LocalPhoto localPhoto,
                              int index)
        Show the confirm delete dialog, and if choose to delete the the photo, and pressed delete button, then call delete photo method. to delete the photo from the storage, and remove it from the local photos list, so all the application can be synchronized.
        Parameters:
        localPhoto - is the local photo you want to delete and remove from the application.
        index - the index of the local photo in the list ...

      • deleteLocalPhoto

        private void deleteLocalPhoto(LocalPhoto localPhoto,
                              int index)
        Apply deleting photo: method that firstly remove the photo from the local photos list, so the application can be synchronized And then delete the local photo from the local storage.
        Parameters:
        localPhoto - is the local photo object you want to remove and delete.
        index - is the index of the local photo you want to remove and delete.
